snippet: The troubles at Barclays, months before the new arena bearing its name in Brooklyn opens, are more evidence that money isn’t all that comes with naming rights.
abstract: Richard Sandomir Sports Business column observes that stadium and arena naming rights inhabit a quirky corner of the sports universe; suggests that the troubles at Barclays, months before the opening of the Brooklyn Nets new Barclays arena, is more evidence that money is not all that comes with naming rights.
lead_paragraph: The troubles at Barclays, months before the new arena bearing its name in Brooklyn opens, are more evidence that money isn’t all that comes with naming rights.
